thread.title: Amit Shah's Spiritual Sojourn: Prayers at Lord Venkateswara | Entertainment
thread.title_full: Amit Shah's Spiritual Sojourn: Prayers at Lord Venkateswara | Entertainment

author: PTI
title: Amit Shah's Spiritual Sojourn: Prayers at Lord Venkateswara | Entertainment
text:
Union Home Minister Amit Shah visited the Lord Venkateswara temple in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh, with his wife, Sonal Shah. They participated in rituals and received blessings from the temple priests, including gifts like a diary, ayurvedic products, and a consecrated sweet. The visit followed prayers at Kottai Bhairavar temple in Tamil Nadu. PTI | Tirupati | Updated: 31-05-2024 14:27 IST | Created: 31-05-2024 14:27 IST
Amit Shah Country: India SHARE Union Home Minister Amit Shah offered prayers at Lord Venkateswara temple here on Friday, said an official.
Accompanied by his wife Sonal Shah, the BJP leader reached the temple at around 8 am and spent half an hour there, participating in the rituals.
''The temple priests blessed Shah and also gifted him a diary, ayurvedic products, laddu (consecrated sweet) and other items,'' the official told PTI.
On Thursday, Shah offered prayers at the Kottai Bhairavar temple in Pudukkottai in Tamil Nadu.
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
